intro: Orthophytum magalhaesii, commonly known as the Magalhães' orthophytum, is a succulent plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color, with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. It produces tall, branched inflorescences with small, white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months. Orthophytum magalhaesii is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
